lead_paragraph: Darnell Earley, the state-appointed emergency manager of Detroit Public Schools, who had also managed Flint and oversaw its decision to draw its water from the Flint River, has resigned.

headline.print_headline: Ex-Manager in Flint Quits Schools Post in Detroit
headline.main: Flint’s Former Manager Resigns as Head of Detroit Schools

snippet: Darnell Earley, the state-appointed emergency manager of Detroit Public Schools, who had also managed Flint and oversaw its decision to draw its water from the Flint River, has resigned.
abstract: Darnell Earley, appointed by Michigan Gov Rick Snyder as both emergency manager of Detroit Public Schools and of city of Flint, resigns; Early, who oversaw decision to take its water from Flint River, left both positions after declining to testify before congressional panel in Washington probing lead contamination of Flint's tap water.
